column4: can someone tell me how to install a package from packages.ubuntu.com?  i have a package.orig.tar.gz containing a bunch of .pkg files and i have no idea how to install it with dpkg
i am in a real bind, if anyone can help that would be great
and that'll work even with an orig.tar.gz in the same directory?
do i have to put the tar.gz in the package repository dir or something?
no.  That works through the internet.  Package.ubuntu.com is a place to browse.  You don't need the tar.gz
well i downloaded the package because i don't have the internet, i need to install it manually before i get drivers support for my network card to get on to the net
ah.  You need to download the .debs, that gz you have now is a list of names of packages.
okay cool, but where do i find the .deb downloads? there doesn't seem to be any links to a .deb on the individual package pages

on each package's page, at the bottom, is a little table with different arches.  Click your arch, and you'll be able to choose a mirror to download a specific .deb file. install that with dpkg (don't forget dependencies!)
no i have nforce 430 chipset, i need restricted drivers, which i *think* will work
Restricted drivers?  That's not a package.  But, ndiswrapper is on the CD you have, you dont need to sneakernet, youve already got it
you might be interested in ndiswrapper

RAOF, SuperLag, the problem is when i run lspci, it just has tonnes of 'unknown nvidia device'. the built in ethernet on the board has drivers for it, but (i think) because i don't have drivers for the system bus (nforce 430 drivers) i can't even get the system to see the ethernet either
